content: a c and b c to have a three striped look you can vary the number of row between colors or make it symmetrical for the socks in pictures i knitted 4 row of color a 1 row of color c 4 row of color b and 1 row of color c and repeated if you make stripes here is a quick tutorial on how to carry yarn that will save you from weaving in all the ends https //youtu be/hpgfrdqqr8q si=sf0qifh8orr3s3ff and here is a tutorial on how to avoid jogs when changing colors https //youtu be/w-_fpyd4dgq si=ej1xpmxs_q-uxygv forethought heel placement using a scrap yarn knit across half of your stitches then start again from the beginning of round using your main color knitting over the scrap yarn if you are making your socks striped it looks best if you insert a heel between two stripes leg work in stockinette for 10-15cm following the color scheme of the foot ^ change this length based on how long you want your sock cuff with ribbing and cast off when you reach the desired length knit 3 row with color a using 3mm needles and with color a *knit 1 purl 1* ** to the end of the row for 4 row k all stitches for another row cast off using the a stretchy bind off images at https //ysolda com/blogs/journal/3-stretchy-bind-offs - step 1 k 2 sts - step 2 k these 2 sts together through the back loop - step 3 k 1 st from the left needle repeat steps 2 and 3 until 2 sts are left then work step 2 once more forethought heel construction https //youtu be/kttj8f83fx4 t=1006 pick up the stitches in the row above and below the scrap yarn be sure it s half of your stitch count unravel the scrap yarn or trim it using color c k across one side of the heel pick up two stitches on this side k across the other side of the heel and pick up the same amount of sts on the other corner k two other row in stockinette work in the round to decrease - r1 *k1 ssk k until 3 sts left on the needle k2tog k1* repeat ** on the other needle - r2 k all sts repeat row 1 and 2 until you have 10 16 20 26 30 36 40 46 sts left divided on the two needles close the heel using a kitchener stitch https //youtu be/qwl2ob4anog si=hwtrubmmvql42o4e cut the yarn and thread it on a needle go through the first st of bottom needle knitwise and take off the knitting needle go through the second st purlwise and leave on go through the first st of top needle purlwise and take off go through second st knitwise and leave on continue till end repeat for the second sock weave in all ends and block your socks thank you for using this pattern and for any questions write to me
